name: flimsily
content:
flimsily adverb
(NOT STRONGLY)
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that is easily broken or destroyed, or that does not give much protection : The huts were flimsily constructed and did not keep out the rain. Flimsily clothed models stood beside the new cars.
More examplesFewer examplesConsidering how expensive they were, the blocks were flimsily built.A sign is flimsily suspended above the doorway.Ships carrying bulk cargoes split in half in the middle of the ocean, simply because they were built too flimsily.

flimsily adverb
(DIFFICULT TO BELIEVE)
in a way that is weak and difficult to believe: The allegations against him were flimsily based. The flimsily sourced rumours made it into newspapers across the country.
More examplesFewer examplesThey had to fall back on flimsily supported anecdote.The plot is flimsily uninteresting.The ability of reporters to protect their sources is based somewhat flimsily on an interpretation of the US Constitution.
